Homebrew Imperial Knights Organization Data[edit | edit source]

Imperial Knights Organization Data created by Wikia user Droidscotty.

See also: Organizations

The Imperial Knights, formally the Knights of the Empire, are an order of Force-practitioners loyal to the Emperor of The Fel Empire. The Imperial Knights serve The Force by serving an Empire that brought order, with their duty being to the Emperor.

Type: Force Tradition

Enemies and Allies: Prior to its fracturing, The Galactic Empire and The Fel Empire were one and the same, and allies of The Imperial Knights. During this time, The Imperial Knights largely engaged against criminal syndicates to stabilize the region, until The Sith-Imperial War where they fought against The Jedi and The Galactic Alliance. Following the conflict, The Imperial Knights now protect Emperor Roan Fel from The Galactic Empire ruled by Darth Krayt.

Scale: 15 (Galactic Region)

Criteria Tables: The following criteria can affect the Organization Scores of members of The Imperial Knights.

CRITERIA MODIFIER
POSITIVE CRITERIA
Experience +1/2 Character Levels
Charisma 13 or higher +1
Possess the Skill Focus (Use the Force) Feat +1
Possess a Force Technique +1
Possess a Force Secret +1 per Force Secret
30 or more years in The Imperial Knights +1
Completes a Mission for The Imperial Knights +1 per 4 Missions
Bring an enemy of The Imperial Knights to justice +1/16 Opponent's CL
Passed the training on Bastion +1
Trained a Squire to Knighthood +1 per Student
Saved a Planetary Government or Organization allied to The Imperial Knights +1
NEGATIVE CRITERIA
Charisma 8 or lower -1
Committed an act of cowardice or surrender at a battle -3
Disobeyed an order from the Emperor/Empress -10

Titles, Benefits, and Duties: The following includes the various ranks and titles of The Imperial Knights, as well as their benefits and duties befitting their stature.

RANK SCORE BENEFITS AND DUTIES
Page 0-8 Pages are junior members, who receive provisional training. Those that succeed become Squires of more experienced Imperial Knights.
  • Pages gain access to an Astromech Droid or Protocol Droid that has no more than three Nonheroic levels (No Heroic Classes).
Squire 9-17 Squires are the apprentices of Master Imperial Knights, that are trained to act independently in support of their Emperor/Empress.
  • Squires gain free transportation while within the Empire's sphere of influence, access to a Starfighter for up to 1 week, and access to Imperial Intelligence that allows them to make a Gather Information check from anywhere in the galaxy.
  • Squires are required to follow their Masters on missions from The Imperial Knights.
Knight 18-25 Knights are the core of The Imperial Knights, have passed their training and been knighted by the Emperor/Empress.
  • Knights can obtain a meeting with an official, ruler, or leader of The Imperial Knights or a group friendly to The Imperial Knights in 1d4 days; receive free medical care while within the Empire's sphere of influence; gain access to a Space Transport for up to 1 week, and can spend a Force Point to immediately requisition 10,000 credits' worth of supplies, regardless of restrictions.
  • Knights are required to protect the persona of the Emperor/Empress even at the cost of their lives, participate in battles against enemies of The Imperial Knights, and perform dangerous missions for The Imperial Knights.
Veteran Knight 26-35 Veteran Knights are seasoned veterans of The Imperial Knights, serving the Emperor/Empress for several years.
  • Veteran Knights gain access to a specialist agent (One who has no more than eight levels, Heroic or Nonheroic) while within the Empire's sphere of influence.
  • Veteran Knights are required to kill, capture, or disable enemies of The Imperial Knights.
Master Knight 36-40 Personally appointed by the Emperor/Empress, these Knights train the next generation of Imperial Knights while helping to stabilize the Empire.
  • Master Knights are required to train a Squire.
High Master Knight 41-51 An honorary title granted to only the most respect Master Knights, High Master Knights are personal advisors and guards to the Emperor/Empress.
  • High Master Knights can obtain a meeting with an official, ruler, or leader of a rival (But not enemy) Organization in 1d4 days (Maximum once every three months).
Emperor/Empress 52+ The reigning royal of The Fel Empire, commanding both the Empire and their Knights.
  • Emperors/Empresses are required to elevate Veteran Knights to Master Knights.

Connection to The Force is far more common among Miralukans than other Species. Miralukans also rely on The Force more than any other Species because they depend on The Force to sense their surroundings in lieu of their lost eyesight. Thus, Miralukans do not regard being with The Force as seers or mystics, and mystically based Force Traditions have few supporters in Miralukan society.

However, some Miralukans do present an increased aptitude with the sense-based aspects of The Force. Once identified, Miralukan educators and leaders encourage such individual to join The Luka Sense, a formal organization, with meditation and education chambers in most cities on their homeworld. The Luka Sene concentrates first and foremost on developing the powers of their membership, particularly sense-related powers. Luka Sene is academic in atmosphere and and culture. Mysticism is still present, but used by most members as a basis for more practical application of Force Powers. Offworlders regard The Luka Sene as a university for Force-users, a place where classes and education take place, but not a tradition that dominates an attendee's personal life to the degree seen in Jedi, Sith, or other Force Traditions.

Members of the Luka Sene participate in all aspects of society and all fields. Most have only small degrees of increased sensitivity, which they use to improve their own lives, careers, and Miralukan society. Those more gifted in The Force might become Administrators, Masters, or Mentors in the Luka Sene organization. A few eventually leave to join the Jedi order. It is uncommon to encounter a Luka Sene member off their homeworld, but some travel to meet the Jedi order, or at the uncommon request of an off-world family seeking advice on a talented child.

The Luka Sene provides guidance to protect Miralukans from falling prey to The Dark Side. Miralukans' inherent sensing abilities are not normally regarded as a threat, but they can still provide a path to The Dark Side, especially in the talented individuals targeted for Luka Sene training. Some Miralukans seek to develop powers contrary to the Luka Sene's emphasis on The Light Side and practical sides of The Force. When a Miralukan is suspected of falling to The Dark Side, a Luka Sene team called the Sene Seekers might search him or her out to alter the individual's path. If redemption is hopeless, these teams are accompanied by security personnel to help capture or eliminate the dark sider.

Members of The Luka Sene Force Tradition can select Talents from the Luka Sene Talent Tree.

Membership[edit | edit source]

Additionally, any Miraluka who has the Force Sensitivity Feat and is living on Alpheridies can be a member of The Luka Sene.
